choices.answer: Heat energy required to raise temperature of a substance.
Heat energy required to change phase of a substance.
Heat energy required to change kinetic energy of substance.
Heat energy reqired to raise temperature of 1kg by 1<sup>o</sup>C.

questions.question: What is Latent Heat of Fusion?

choices.answer: Heat energy to change 1 kg of liquid to gas.
Heat energy to increase temperature of 1 kg of substance.
Heat energy to change 1 kg of solid to liquid.
Heat energy to decrease temperature of 1 kg of substance.

questions.question: What is Latent Heat of Vaporisation?

choices.answer: Heat energy reqired to change 1 kg of solid to liquid.
Heat energy required to change 1 kg of liquid to gas.
Heat energy to increase temperature of 1 kg of substance.
Heat energy to decrease temperature of 1 kg of substance.
Higher than Latent Heat of Vaporisation.
Same as Latent Heat of Vaporisation.
Lower than Latent Heat of Vaporisation.
Same as the Specific Heat Capacity.

questions.question: Specific Heat Capacity of a Liquid is:

choices.answer: Higher than the gas.
Same as the solid.
Lower than the solid.
Higher than the solid.
Potential energy of particles.
Temperature of particles.
Kinetic energy of particles.
Does not affect particles.
Particles changing phase.
Rate of flow of heat energy.
Change in kinetic energy of particles.
Change in potential energy of particles.

questions.question: Sea Breezes form due to the:

choices.answer: High specific heat capacity of land.
Low specific heat capacity of water.
Latent heat of vaporisation of water.
High specific heat capacity of water.

questions.question: Land or Offshore Breezes form because of the:

choices.answer: Low specific heat capacity of land.
Low latent heat of land.
Low specific heat capacity of water.
Low latent heat of water.

questions.question: Latent heat is also known as:

choices.answer: Kinetic heat.
Potential heat.
Visible heat.
Hidden heat.
